conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the rods using electromagnetism and mechanics principles.
Gravitational force component along the inclined plane for rod a is calculated.
Gravitational force on rod a is 1.5 N.
Constant force applied to rod a is 2 N.
Magnetic force on rod a due to current is given by BIL.
Total resistance in the circuit is calculated as 0.2 Ohm.
Induced emf in the circuit due to rod a's motion is 0.1 V.
Current in the circuit is 0.5 A.
Magnetic force on rod a is 0.05 N.
Net force on rod a is calculated as 0.45 N.
Acceleration of rod a is 1.5 m/s².
Current is the same in both rods due to circuit connection.
Magnetic force on rod b is 0.05 N.
Net force on rod b is calculated as -0.45 N.
Acceleration of rod b is -4.5 m/s².
Time taken for rod a to reach velocity of 1.0 m/s is 2/3 s.
Speed of rod b at this time is -3 m/s.
Magnitude of speed of rod b is 3 m/s.
Final answer: Speed magnitude of rod b is 3 m/s when Joule heat in rod a is 0.12 J and its velocity is 1.0 m/s.
